result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Otto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: - Restitution set at $341.00 payable to Kohl's Department Store.
- Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, and restitution By 10-14-2023. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.
- No contact with I.L.C., Kohl's Department Store, Walmart.
- Write letter of apology to I.L.C..

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua M Otto

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua M Otto appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Joshua M Otto.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 1 month in the House of Correction. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:

Conditions of Probation
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.
- 45 hours of community service.
- No contact with I.L.C., Kohl's Department Store, Walmart. 
- Write letter of apology to I.L.C..
- Restitution set at $341.00 payable to Kohl's Department Store. 
- Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, and restitution By 10-14-2023. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Defendant Joshua M Otto in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Joshua M Otto in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Joshua M Otto in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua M Otto appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Joshua M Otto not in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2-24-2022 @2p
